title: HONEY BUCKS
lookFor: 2+ active wilds in first 3 reels (horizontally connected or 1 gap apart) | 3 horizontally connected active wilds anywhere | 4+ active wilds in first 3 reels (empty space = 2 spins left, yellow WILD = 1 spin left, cracked = ignore)
stopPlaying: After all active wilds crack and disappear
safePreviewBlurb: Honey Bucks is a simple game that features persistent wilds. On any spin, up to five bees may randomly fly from the honeycomb reels, leaving an...

images.caption: Five bees flew off the reels, leaving behind five empty spaces in the honeycomb. These spaces will be wild for the next two spins.
This is what the empty spaces from the previous photo will look like after the next spin. Yellow wilds like these will be around for one more spin.
Don‚Äôt play wilds that look like these‚Äîthey will disappear on the next spin.

playWhen: **Option A ‚Äî Two Wilds in First Three Reels:** - 2 active wilds in reels 1-3 - Must be horizontally connected OR one gap apart **Option B ‚Äî Three Connected Wilds:** - 3 horizontally connected active wilds - Can be anywhere on reels **Option C ‚Äî Four Wilds:** - 4+ active wilds in first three reels | Wilds | Position | Action | |-------|----------|--------| | 2 connected/1-gap | Reels 1-3 | ‚úÖ **Play** | | 3 connected | Anywhere | ‚úÖ **Play** | | 4+ | Reels 1-3 | ‚úÖ **Play** | ---
stopWhen:
- All active wilds crack and disappear
- No playable wild combinations remain

---
doNotPlayWhen:
- Wilds are cracked (disappear next spin)
- Only 1 wild in first three reels
- Wilds not horizontally aligned
- 2+ gap between wilds in reels 1-3

---
howItWorks:
Honey Bucks features **persistent wilds** from bees leaving the honeycomb:

**Mechanic:**
- Up to 5 bees randomly fly from honeycomb ‚Üí Leave empty space
- Empty space = WILD for next 2 spins
- Bees fly out every few spins

**Wild Appearance Stages:**
| Visual | Spins Remaining | Playable? |
|--------|-----------------|-----------|
| Empty space in honeycomb | 2 spins | ‚úÖ Yes |
| Yellow "WILD" with honey dripping | 1 spin | ‚úÖ Yes |
| Cracked wild | 0 (disappears next spin) | ‚ùå No |

---
commonMistakes:
- Playing cracked wilds (they disappear next spin)
- Not recognizing wild stages (empty vs yellow vs cracked)
- Playing wilds that aren't horizontally connected/aligned
- Ignoring this game (most APs don't know about it)

---
additionalNotes:
**Hidden Gem:**
- Innocuous game most APs don't know about
- Common to find plays
- Quick in-and-out with few spins
- Great game to hustle

**Aggressive Play:**
- Wilds with 2 spins remaining can be played more aggressively
- Chance to combine with more wilds that appear next spin

**Wild Recognition:**
- Empty honeycomb space = 2 spins left
- Yellow "WILD" with honey = 1 spin left
- Cracked = IGNORE (gone next spin)

title: HYPER ORBS

safePreviewBlurb: (King of the Seas / Dragon Sense) Hyper Orbs features a free spins bonus that gets triggered once 15 orbs are collected.

images.caption: 13 of the 15 orbs needed to trigger the bonus have been collected already. This is an excellent play.
This free spins scatter symbol will stick around for three more spins. Landing two of these will trigger the bonus, so always play if there is a number inside the symbol. It also functions as a wild.

playWhen: **Option A ‚Äî Orb Count:** - Orbs collected: ‚â• 12 **Option B ‚Äî Scatter Symbol:** - Number symbol visible in reel 2 OR reel 4 - Number inside = spins it sticks around - Also functions as wild - Need 2 to trigger bonus **How to Check:** - Look **directly on bet pad** - Shows orb count for each bet level ‚ö†Ô∏è **IMPORTANT:** Check all denominations‚Äîdifferent bet levels have different counts. ---

- Difference negligible

**Game Variants:**

- Money Storm Deluxe ‚úÖ (loud‚Äîturn volume down)
- Lucky Larry's Lobstermania Deluxe ‚úÖ

safePreviewBlurb: Imperial Fortunes and its companion, Penguin Palace, feature coin holders above each of the reels. When two coins are collected to fill the coin...

images.caption: This is a solid play with a 2x coin collected about the third reel and another coin collected above the second reel.
I would play a setup like this for one spin because of the active 2x coin above reel four.
I would avoid setups like this in Red Silk/Aztec Chief, but this is a slightly +EV play due to the possibility of landing a 2x coin in one or more of the first three reels.
This paid out nearly 100x due to the 2x coin in reel two. The middle reel will be wild for one more spin.

A solid bonus with the mini jackpot.
Most of the times you hit the bonus will look like this, where the six wood panels all came down from the top in a big stack in two columns.

Let's (reel 1) + Spin (reel 2) together ‚Üí Triggers wheel spin - Symbols persist for 3 spins after landing - Symbols land in any row ‚Üí Move to top ‚Üí Down one row per spin - Additional Spin symbols in reels 3-4-5 ‚Üí Add extra multipliers **Multiplier Rings (Multiply Together):** | Ring | Reel | Max Multiplier | Jackpot | |------|------|----------------|---------| | 1st | 2 | 4x | Mini | | 2nd | 3 | 5x | Minor | | 3rd | 4 | 8x | Major | | 4th | 5 | 10x | Mega | **Max Combined:** 4x √ó 5x √ó 8x √ó 10x = 1,600x --- ## PLAY WHEN (ANY ONE) **Option A ‚Äî Let's Symbol:** - Let's symbol in reel 1 - **NOT on bottom row** **Option B ‚Äî Spin Symbol in Reel 2:** - Spin symbol in reel 2 - **NOT on bottom row** **Option C ‚Äî Multiple Spin Symbols:** - Spin symbols in **both** reels 3 and 4 - **NOT on bottom row** | Symbol | Reel | Row | Action | |--------|------|-----|--------| | Let's | 1 | Top/Middle | ‚úÖ **Play** | | Let's | 1 | Bottom | ‚ùå Skip | | Spin | 2 | Top/Middle | ‚úÖ **Play** | | Spin | 2 | Bottom | ‚ùå Skip | | Spin | 3+4 | Top/Middle | ‚úÖ **Play** | --- ## DO NOT PLAY WHEN - Symbols only on bottom row (likely disappear next spin) - No Let's or Spin symbols visible --- ## STOP WHEN - Wheel spin bonus completes - All Let's/Spin symbols move off bottom row --- ## COMMON MISTAKES - Playing bottom row symbols (can't tell if first or last appearance) - Not recognizing multipliers MULTIPLY (not add) - Missing massive combined multiplier opportunities --- ## Additional Notes **Bottom Row Uncertainty:** - Can't tell if bottom row symbol is new or expiring - Safest: Assume bottom row symbols disappear next spin - Players who understand often cash out after 3 spins **Multiplier Math:** - Multipliers MULTIPLY together - 3x + 5x + 7x = 105x (not 15x) - 3-4 multipliers at once = Massive wins **Let's Symbol Value:** - Contains credit prize (1x-5x bet) - This is the base amount multipliers apply to **Free Check Method:** 1. Tap menu icon (lower left corner) 2. Use up/down arrows to cycle bet levels 3. No ticket required **Game Variants:** - Let's Spin ‚úÖ - Let's Spin Vegas ‚úÖ (same strategy)

howItWorks:
Life of Luxury Hot Diamonds features **three progressive free games meters** (NOT must-hit-by):

**Meter Types:**
| Meter | Symbol | Luxury Zones | Reset Value |
|-------|--------|--------------|-------------|
| Car | Car | 1 (single) | ~10 |
| Boat | Boat | 2 (double) | ~10 |
| Plane | Plane | 3 (triple) | ~10 |

- Symbol lands ‚Üí Corresponding meter increases
- 3 scatter symbols ‚Üí Spin wheel to determine which bonus
- Completely random when bonus triggers (NOT must-hit-by)

---
commonMistakes:
- Thinking more spins = closer to hitting (NOT TRUE)
- Chasing without adequate bankroll
- Chasing gem progressives (not worth it)
- Not setting a loss limit before playing

---
additionalNotes:

- "On average" is key‚Äîyou may not hit in average spins
- Digging deeper hole doesn't mean closer to hitting
- Set a budget you're comfortable losing
- If you don't hit, call it a loss and move on
- Bankroll management is crucially important

**Bonus Mechanic:**
- Land 3 symbols ‚Üí Spin wheel
- Wheel determines: Car, Boat, or Plane free games
- Luxury Zone on middle row wins credit prizes/gems

**Luxury Zone Value:**
- Car: 1 zone (least valuable)
- Boat: 2 zones (medium)
- Plane: 3 zones (most valuable)

- Great Eagle ‚úÖ

playWhen: **Option A ‚Äî High Active Multiplier:** - Active 10x or 12x multiplier **Option B ‚Äî Combined Active Multipliers:** - Active multipliers totaling ‚â• 10x - Examples: 5x + 5x = 10x | 8x + 3x = 11x **Option C ‚Äî Queue Setup:** - 10x or 12x in upcoming queue - Play through 5x or 8x in front to reach them | Active Multiplier | Queue | Action | |-------------------|-------|--------| | 10x or 12x | Any | ‚úÖ **Play** | | 5x+5x or similar | Any | ‚úÖ **Play** | | 5x or 8x | 10x/12x behind | ‚úÖ **Play** | | Below 10x total | No 10x/12x queued | ‚ùå Skip | ---
stopWhen: - Multiplier triggers on line hit - No 10x+ total remains active or queued ---
doNotPlayWhen: - Active multipliers total below 10x - No 10x/12x in queue - Only question mark tiles (not revealed) - 2x or 3x multipliers only ---
howItWorks: Lucky Empress / Inca Empress features **persistent multipliers** on the left side of rows: **Mechanic:** - Tiles with ? land ‚Üí Move to tile placeholders on left - 3 tiles collected ‚Üí Reveals multipliers (2x, 3x, 5x, 8x, 10x, or 12x) - Bottom multiplier becomes **active** ("X NEXT PAY" shown) - Line hit on that row ‚Üí Multiplier applies and disappears - Next multiplier in queue becomes active **Tile Appearance:** | Game | Tile Shape | |------|------------| | Lucky Empress | Diamond | | Inca Empress | Circle | ---
commonMistakes:
- Chasing question mark tiles (might reveal worthless 2x/3x)
- Perpetually chasing small multipliers (they come up frequently)
- Expecting every play to profit (most lose, big wins cover losses)
- Skipping this game entirely (solid play with right rules)

---
additionalNotes:
**High Variance Warning:**
- Lose money most of the time
- Line hits often pathetic ($0.10)
- 10x multiplier might only win $1
- Occasional $100+ wins cover losses

**Don't Chase:**
- Multipliers come up frequently
- Don't get tricked into perpetual chasing
- Question marks might be worthless 2x/3x

**Game Differences:**
| Feature | Lucky Empress | Inca Empress |
|---------|---------------|--------------|
| Progressives | Yes | No |
| Tile shape | Diamond | Circle |
| RTP | 85%‚Äì94% | 85%‚Äì96% |

Strategy is same for both versions.

**Many APs Skip This:**
- But it's solid if you follow rules
- Accept frequent losses
- Big wins make up for it

images.caption: This is a solid play with one coin collected in each of the Loot Awards above reels two, three and four.
Combining the Wild Stacks Loot Award with the King Stacks Loot Award can lead to nice wins such as this.
The Wild Stacks Loot Award can also be combined with the Double Symbols Loot Award.
Always play if there is a Bonus Loot Award present, as shown at the top of reel two.

playWhen: **Option A ‚Äî Three Reels Setup:** - 1 coin in each of 3 Loot Awards (reels 2, 3, 4) - Stop after triggering one **Option B ‚Äî Active Loot Award:** - Shows "2 Spins Left" or "1 Spin Left" **Option C ‚Äî Bonus Loot Award:** - Bonus present on any reel - **Any coin count** (even 0) **Option D ‚Äî Jackpot Loot Award:** - Jackpot present with 1+ coins - (0 coins is +EV but high variance) **Option E ‚Äî Completed Awards (1 Spin Gamble):** Play 1 spin to see if Jackpot/Bonus replaces it: - 1 completed + 1 coin in other two - 2 completed awards - 3 completed awards (rare) *(Only if completed awards are NOT Jackpot/Bonus)* ---
stopWhen:
- Any Loot Award triggers
- Re-evaluate remaining awards

---
doNotPlayWhen:
- No coins and no special Loot Awards (Bonus/Jackpot)
- Just triggered a Loot Award (re-evaluate)

---
howItWorks: Lucky Larry's Lobstermania 4 Link / Super Sally's Shrimpmania 4 Link features **Loot Awards** above reels 2, 3, and 4: **Mechanic:** - 2 coins collected ‚Üí Loot Award activates - Coins appear as sub-symbols (don't block regular symbols) - Coins land frequently ‚Üí Low investment usually **Loot Award Types:** | Type | Value | Notes | |------|-------|-------| | Bonus | Best | Always play if present | | Jackpot | High variance | Can bust but huge potential | | Others | Good | Standard awards | ---
commonMistakes:
- Not recognizing Bonus Loot Award (always play)
- Waiting for coins on Jackpot Loot Award (0 coins is +EV)
- Not checking all three Loot Award positions

---
additionalNotes:
**Excellent Hustle Game:**
- One of best new advantage games
- Ploppies don't understand it
- Common to find profitable plays

**Multiple Awards:**
- Getting 2+ Loot Awards active simultaneously = Huge wins
- Awards trigger more on higher bet levels

**Bonus Loot Award Choice:**
| Option | Volatility | Typical Result |
|--------|------------|----------------|
| Bucket bonus | Low | Solid payout |
| Free games | High | Hit or miss (0-100x) |

**Award Replacement:**
- Completed award replaced by different award
- Won't be same as previous or other active awards
- 2 completed doesn't guarantee Bonus/Jackpot appears

**Visual Cue:**
- Larry/Sally dances across screen before 2nd coin lands for Bonus/Jackpot

**Game Variants:**
- Lucky Larry's Lobstermania 4 Link ‚úÖ
- Super Sally's Shrimpmania 4 Link ‚úÖ

lookFor: 3 wilds revealed | 2 wilds + multiplier, 4+ free games, or 5+ credits revealed | 1 wild + 10 or fewer picks remaining | 7 or fewer picks remaining (any setup)
stopPlaying: After free games bonus triggers (keep playing until bonus - never stop early)
safePreviewBlurb: Lucky Pick features a board above the reels with 21 picks that are covered up. Landing a Lucky Pick symbol on the reels lets the player reveal one...

images.caption: Landing the Lucky Pick symbol (shown in the middle reel) will let you choose one of the picks on the board above (there are only two picks remaining).
After the free games bonus ends, the board is reset and three random non-credit picks are revealed. This is the best possible reset scenario, with three wilds revealed.
During the free games bonus, you can get massive line hits thanks to the wilds and multipliers.
This is the worst possible setup you can find with two wilds revealed. I would skip this play unless I knew I was on a higher RTP or if I was trying to build points.
We know we are on board D here because there are 10 credit picks revealed. Therefore, there is another wild remaining and we have a good chance of revealing it because there are only five picks left.
Plays like this might look tempting because there are a lot of picks revealed, but I would skip this because there are no wilds.
This is a common type of play that you will find. It might look promising because of the three multipliers, but with just one wild, it is too risky.
With just one wild, this is a mediocre play. But with only 10 picks remaining, plays like these are +EV over the long run.
We know we are on board B here because of the two +3 free games. Board B is the lowest-paying board and there are 14 picks remaining, so I would pass on this play.
I would never play a setup like this. We know we are on the worst-paying board (B) and there are no wilds revealed.
This is another example of a board that I would never play. It‚Äôs too early to determine what board we are on, but without any wilds, it is way too risky.

stopWhen:
- Free games bonus triggers
- **NEVER stop before bonus** (keep playing until bonus!)

---
doNotPlayWhen:
- No wilds revealed + many picks remaining
- Only on Board B with no wilds (worst board)
- Insufficient bankroll for the bet level

---
howItWorks: Lucky Pick features a **21-pick board with free games bonus**: **Mechanic:** - Board has 21 covered picks above reels - Lucky Pick symbol lands ‚Üí Reveal one pick - Picks = Credit prizes (instant) OR upgrades (for free games) - 3 scatter symbols ‚Üí Triggers free games bonus - After bonus: Board resets with 3 random non-credit picks revealed **Free Games Default Values:** - 3 free games - 1 random wild added to reels 2-5 each spin - 2x multiplier on all wins ---
commonMistakes:
- Stopping before free games bonus (loses all equity)
- Overvaluing free games picks vs wild picks
- Playing without adequate bankroll
- Not recognizing which board you're on

---
additionalNotes: **Most Lucrative AP Game in Years:** - Majority of payout comes from free games bonus - Players quitting early = Huge equity left behind - $300+ bonuses possible even on $0.60 bet **Pick Statistics:** - Lucky Pick symbol: 1 in 23 spins - Free games trigger: 1 in 141 spins - Average picks revealed before bonus: 6 (half credits, half upgrades) **Upgrade Values:** | Pick | Effect | |------|--------| | Credit | 2x-5x bet (instant) | | +1 Wild | Extra wild on reels 2-5 each spin | | +1x Multiplier | Increases all wins multiplier by 1x | | +1/+2/+3 FG | Additional free games | **Board Fully Revealed = Jackpot:** - All 21 picks revealed = Massive guaranteed bonus - Worth several hundred units - Consider camping if someone is close **Free Check Method:** 1. Tap menu icon (lower left) 2. Use arrows to cycle bet levels 3. No ticket required **RTP Range:** - 85% to 96% **Game Variants:** - Bumble Bee ‚úÖ - Cash Tree ‚úÖ - Leprechaun ‚úÖ (same strategy)

It might look promising because of the three multipliers, but with just one wild, it is too risky. ### Image 12 ![Lucky Pick: Bumble Bee / Cash Tree / Leprechaun](images/lucky-pick-bumble-bee--cash-tree--leprechaun-12.jpg) ### Image 13 ![Lucky Pick: Bumble Bee / Cash Tree / Leprechaun](images/lucky-pick-bumble-bee--cash-tree--leprechaun-13.jpg) **Description:** With just one wild, this is a mediocre play. But with only 10 picks remaining, plays like these are +EV over the long run. ### Image 14 ![Lucky Pick: Bumble Bee / Cash Tree / Leprechaun](images/lucky-pick-bumble-bee--cash-tree--leprechaun-14.jpg) **Description:** We know we are on board B here because of the two +3 free games. Board B is the lowest-paying board and there are 14 picks remaining, so I would pass on this play. ### Image 15 ![Lucky Pick: Bumble Bee / Cash Tree / Leprechaun](images/lucky-pick-bumble-bee--cash-tree--leprechaun-15.jpg) **Description:** I would never play a setup like this. We know we are on the worst-paying board (B) and there are no wilds revealed. ### Image 16 ![Lucky Pick: Bumble Bee / Cash Tree / Leprechaun](images/lucky-pick-bumble-bee--cash-tree--leprechaun-16.jpg) **Description:** This is another example of a board that I would never play. It‚Äôs too early to determine what board we are on, but without any wilds, it is way too risky. ## How The Advantage Works Lucky Pick features a **21-pick board with free games bonus**: **Mechanic:** - Board has 21 covered picks above reels - Lucky Pick symbol lands ‚Üí Reveal one pick - Picks = Credit prizes (instant) OR upgrades (for free games) - 3 scatter symbols ‚Üí Triggers free games bonus - After bonus: Board resets with 3 random non-credit picks revealed **Free Games Default Values:** - 3 free games - 1 random wild added to reels 2-5 each spin - 2x multiplier on all wins --- ## ‚ö†Ô∏è CRITICAL: NEVER STOP EARLY **Always play until free games bonus triggers.** - Average: 6 minutes - Worst case: Up to 30 minutes - All equity is in the bonus‚Äîstopping early = losing value **Bankroll Requirement:** - Minimum 600x bet size - Example: $6 bet = $3,600 bankroll needed --- ## PLAY WHEN ### Basic Plays (Recommended for Beginners) **Option A ‚Äî Three Wilds:** - 3 wilds revealed **Option B ‚Äî Two Wilds + Extras:** - 2 wilds revealed PLUS any of: - 1 multiplier + any other upgrade - 4+ total free games revealed - 5 credit picks revealed **Option C ‚Äî One Wild + Few Picks:** - 1 wild revealed - 10 or fewer picks remaining **Option D ‚Äî Few Picks (Any Setup):** - 7 or fewer picks remaining (regardless of what's revealed) ### Aggressive Plays (Competitive Markets / Point Building) | Setup | Threshold | |-------|-----------| | 2 wilds | Any (always play) | | 1 wild | 11 or fewer picks remaining | | Any | 8 or fewer picks remaining | *Note: Aggressive plays may be -EV to breakeven on low RTP, +EV on medium-high RTP.* --- ## DO NOT PLAY WHEN - No wilds revealed + many picks remaining - Only on Board B with no wilds (worst board) - Insufficient bankroll for the bet level --- ## STOP WHEN - Free games bonus triggers - **NEVER stop before bonus** (keep playing until bonus!) --- ## COMMON MISTAKES - Stopping before free games bonus (loses all equity) - Overvaluing free games picks vs wild picks - Playing without adequate bankroll - Not recognizing which board you're on --- ## Advanced Strategy: Board Recognition **Four Possible Boards:** | Board | Credits | Wilds | Multipliers | Total FG | Rank | |-------|---------|-------|-------------|----------|------| | **C** | 9 | **3** | 2 | 10 | **Best** | | **D** | 11 | **3** | 3 | 4 | 2nd | | **A** | 8 | 2 | 4 | 10 | 3rd | | **B** | 9 | 2 | 2 | 17 | **Worst** | **Board Identification Clues:** | You See | Board Eliminated | |---------|------------------| | Any +2 or +3 FG | NOT Board D | | Multiple +2 or +3 FG | Board B | | 10+ credits revealed | Board D | **Why Wilds Are Critical:** - Wilds > Multipliers > Free Games (usually) - Goal: Enter bonus with 2-3 wilds revealed - 3-wild bonus wins cover multiple losses --- ## Additional Notes **Most Lucrative AP Game in Years:** - Majority of payout comes from free games bonus - Players quitting early = Huge equity left behind - $300+ bonuses possible even on $0.60 bet **Pick Statistics:** - Lucky Pick symbol: 1 in 23 spins - Free games trigger: 1 in 141 spins - Average picks revealed before bonus: 6 (half credits, half upgrades) **Upgrade Values:** | Pick | Effect | |------|--------| | Credit | 2x-5x bet (instant) | | +1 Wild | Extra wild on reels 2-5 each spin | | +1x Multiplier | Increases all wins multiplier by 1x | | +1/+2/+3 FG | Additional free games | **Board Fully Revealed = Jackpot:** - All 21 picks revealed = Massive guaranteed bonus - Worth several hundred units - Consider camping if someone is close **Free Check Method:** 1. Tap menu icon (lower left) 2. Use arrows to cycle bet levels 3. No ticket required **RTP Range:** - 85% to 96% **Game Variants:** - Bumble Bee ‚úÖ - Cash Tree ‚úÖ - Leprechaun ‚úÖ (same strategy)

title: MAGIC WISHES
lookFor: Check spin counter (X of 10) and count locked frames aligned horizontally on the same row | Later spins (7-9) need fewer frames | earlier spins (1-6) need 3-4+ frames on same row | Frames on left reels are more valuable
stopPlaying: After 10th spin completes (all accumulated frames turn wild)
safePreviewBlurb: Magic Wishes operates on a ten game cycle. All locked frames accumulated during the ten game cycle will turn wild on the tenth spin. The game is...

images.caption: The game counter on the bottom right shows this game is on spin 4 of 10. Landing the lamp symbol creates the locked frames. These frames accumulate up until spin ten, when they all will turn wild.
Five-of-a-kind wilds pay very well, as you can see on this $16.41 win on a $0.75 bet.

stopWhen:
- Spin 10 completes
- All frames turn wild
- Cycle resets

---
doNotPlayWhen: - Game 10 of 10 (NEVER) - Frames not aligned horizontally (late in cycle) - Only 3-of-a-kind possible (pays poorly) ---
howItWorks:
Magic Wishes operates on a **10-game cycle** with frame collection:

**Mechanic:**
- Lamp lands ‚Üí Creates locked frames
- Frames accumulate through 10-game cycle
- Spin 10 ‚Üí All accumulated frames turn WILD
- Lamp occasionally shoots out multiple frames (volatile)

**Goal:** Frames lined up horizontally for 4-of-a-kind or 5-of-a-kind

---
commonMistakes:
- Playing game 10 of 10
- Expecting 3-of-a-kind to pay well (aim for 4+ of a kind)
- Not prioritizing horizontal alignment late in cycle
- Not recognizing lamp can shoot multiple frames (volatile)

---
additionalNotes:
**Simplified Rule:**
- Lots of frames on left side
- Preferably connected horizontally
- Further in cycle = Better value

**Strategy Logic:**
- Mid-cycle plays: Getting 10-cycle return for partial cost
- Earlier in cycle = More gambling (outcome less known)
- Game 9 abandoned = Almost always worth playing

**Compared to Scarab/Diamond Mania:**
- More payout in jackpots and bonus features
- Line hits with wilds less lucrative

**Free Games Bonus:**
| Option | Free Games | Random Wilds | Volatility |
|--------|------------|--------------|------------|
| A | 15 | 5 | Low |
| B | 10 | 7 | Medium |
| C | 5 | 10 | High |

All options pay same on average‚Äîchoose 15 games to lower variance.

howItWorks: Mammoth Legend features **coin elimination for guaranteed Volcano Bonus**: **Mechanic:** - Bonus symbol lands fully in reel 5 ‚Üí Pick from 5 coins - 1 coin = Volcano Bonus, 4 coins = Credit prizes - Pick credit prize ‚Üí That coin removed for next time - 1 coin remaining ‚Üí Guaranteed Volcano Bonus next pick ---
commonMistakes:
- Playing with multiple coins remaining
- Not having adequate bankroll for variance
- Expecting guaranteed profit (can still lose with mini jackpot)

additionalNotes:

fullContent:
## Thumbnail

![Hero](images/ocean-magic-grand-1.jpg)

## Gameplay Images

### Image 1

![OCEAN MAGIC GRAND](images/ocean-magic-grand-1.jpg)

### Image 2

![OCEAN MAGIC GRAND](images/ocean-magic-grand-2.jpg)

**Description:** This is an excellent walk-up play that I found. Bubbles often come in big spurts like this.

### Image 3

![OCEAN MAGIC GRAND](images/ocean-magic-grand-3.jpg)

### Image 4

![OCEAN MAGIC GRAND](images/ocean-magic-grand-4.jpg)

**Description:** Getting multiple wild bubbles to expand at once can lead to huge wins like this.

### Image 5

![OCEAN MAGIC GRAND](images/ocean-magic-grand-5.jpg)

**Description:** The free games bonus is tough to land, but it can pay very well.

## How The Advantage Works

Ocean Magic Grand features **wild bubbles that move UP**:

**Mechanic:**
- Wild bubbles move UP one row every spin
- Bubble lands on Ocean Magic symbol ‚Üí ALL surrounding symbols turn wild
- Expansion: symbols above, below, left, right (if room)

**Key Differences from Regular Ocean Magic:**
- 50% taller reels
- Play tighter (single bubbles worth less)
- Multiple bubbles = Even bigger win potential

**Strategy is SAME for Regular and Bubble Boost modes.**

---

## PLAY WHEN (ANY ONE)

**Option A ‚Äî Reels 2-3 (Most Valuable):**
- Wild bubbles in reels 2 or 3
- Include "sunrise" bubbles below bottom row
- Stop when bubble reaches 2nd row from top

**Option B ‚Äî Reels 1 + 4 Combo:**
- Bubble in reel 1 AND bubble in reel 4
- Bubbles within 1-2 rows of each other
- Stop when either reaches 2nd row from top

**Option C ‚Äî Sunrise Bubbles (Test Spin):**
- Sunrise bubble in reel 1 or 4
- Play 1 spin to check for foghorn or additional bubbles

| Bubble Location | Action |
|-----------------|--------|
| Reels 2-3 (any row including sunrise) | ‚úÖ **Play** |
| Reel 1 + Reel 4 (aligned) | ‚úÖ **Play** |
| Sunrise in reel 1 or 4 | ‚úÖ **1 spin test** |
| Reel 5 only | ‚ùå Skip (mostly worthless) |

---

## DO NOT PLAY WHEN

- Bubble reaches 2nd row from top (only 1 spin remaining)
- Only reel 5 bubbles
- Single bubble in reel 1 without reel 4 partner

---

## STOP WHEN

- Bubble reaches 2nd row from top (1 spin remaining)

---

## COMMON MISTAKES

- Not checking sunrise bubbles (often overlooked)
- Playing single reel 1 bubbles without reel 4 partner
- Not stopping when bubble reaches 2nd-from-top row
- Confusing expanded wilds with real bubbles

---

## Additional Notes

**Sunrise Bubbles (Below Bottom Row):**
- Most valuable because often overlooked
- Come up in spurts
- Always check these!

**Distinguishing Real Bubbles from Expanded Wilds:**
- After expansion, screen shows wilds everywhere
- Hard to tell which are real bubbles
- **Trick:** Switch bet level and back ‚Üí Expanded wilds disappear

**Why Reels 2-3 Are Best:**
- More room to expand on both sides
- Top row bubbles less valuable (less expansion room)

**Multiple Bubbles = Big Wins:**
- Single bubble without expansion = Likely loss
- Multiple bubble expansions = Gigantic wins

**Bubble Boost Mode:**
- Same strategy as regular mode
- Bubbles come in streaks
- Foghorn more likely when bubbles already present
- Extra cost evens out with foghorn wins

**Free Games Bonus:**
- Bubble pick is just entertainment
- No effect on outcome

howItWorks:
Phoenix 888 Dragon features **two must-hit-by progressive jackpots**:

| Jackpot | Must Hit By | Resets To | Realistic Chance At |
|---------|-------------|-----------|---------------------|
| Mini | $500 | $200 | $490+ |
| Major | $5,000 | $4,000 | $4,990+ |

**Weighted to Top:** Jackpots almost always hit near maximum. Hitting early is exceedingly rare.

---
commonMistakes:
- Max betting (can lose thousands on bad run)
- Taking play too early hoping to get lucky
- Playing $5,000 without considering taxes
- Not using player's card (losing points)
- Insufficient bankroll

---
additionalNotes:
**Conservative vs Aggressive:**
- Numbers above are conservative (account for lower RTP)
- Most APs jump at $475 / $4,900
- Some take early to block other hustlers
- Waiting higher = More profit

**Min Bet Strategy:**
- Reduces variance significantly
- Avoids handpays (no W-2G waiting)
- Smooths out ups and downs
- Max bet = More "gambling"

**Ploppy Warning:**
- High progressives attract casual players
- Watch play more closely as numbers approach threshold

**Tax Consideration ($5,000):**
- Factor in taxes on large jackpot
- May need to wait for higher numbers

**RTP:** 86% to 95%

**Player's Card:**
- Use it‚Äîespecially for $5,000 chase
- Points can lead to lucrative freeplay offers

playWhen: **Note:** Can play gold dragons even without green dots‚Äîcoin resets counter. **Option A ‚Äî Two Gold Dragons:** - 2 or more gold dragons anywhere **Option B ‚Äî Single Gold Dragon (Reel 1 or 5):** - Prize at least 10x bet **Option C ‚Äî Single Gold Dragon (Reel 2 or 4):** - Prize at least 40x bet | Setup | Prize Threshold | Action | |-------|-----------------|--------| | 2+ gold dragons | Any | ‚úÖ **Play** | | 1 gold (reel 1/5) | 10x+ bet | ‚úÖ **Play** | | 1 gold (reel 2/4) | 40x+ bet | ‚úÖ **Play** | | 1 gold (reel 3) | ‚ùå Too difficult | Skip | ---

Pillars of Cash features **pillars that build credit prizes with gold dragon triggers**:

**Mechanic:**

- No dots + no coin = Pillar drops one level
- Pillar hits top ‚Üí Dragon turns **GOLD**
- Coin lands on gold dragon reel ‚Üí Chance to win prize

**Pillar Heights for Gold Dragon:**
| Reel | Height Required | Prize Size | Difficulty |
|------|-----------------|------------|------------|
| 1, 5 | 4 high | Smallest | Easiest |
| 2, 4 | 5 high | Larger | Much harder |
| 3 | 6 high | Largest | Extremely hard |

---
commonMistakes:
- Playing single golds without meeting prize threshold
- Thinking no green dots = can't play (coin resets it)
- Chasing middle reel gold dragons

---
additionalNotes:
**Not Guaranteed:**
- Gold dragon + coin = CHANCE to win (not guaranteed)
- Can be frustrating
- Low risk (usually few spins)

**Pillars on Fire:**
- Just awarded on previous spin
- Will reset next spin

**Free Check Method:**
- Tap bet level on main touchscreen
- Or push bet pad buttons
- No money required

**Game Variants:**
- Celestial Fortune ‚úÖ
- Festive Fortune ‚úÖ (same strategy)

title: PINWHEEL PRIZES
lookFor: 10+ golden wedges in green + blue wheels combined | 15+ golden wedges total (check count on bet pad)
stopPlaying: After golden wedge prize awarded (wedge resets to default) and remaining golden wedges fall below threshold
safePreviewBlurb: (Cat & Tiger / Majestic Oasis) Pinwheel Prizes features five pinwheels above the reels‚Äîgreen, blue, purple, orange and red. Each pinwheel has eight...

images.caption: This free spins bonus retriggered to 16 games, which gave me a win of over 100x my bet.

playWhen: **Option A ‚Äî Green + Blue Focus:** - 10+ golden wedges in green + blue combined - (Green and blue are easiest to trigger) **Option B ‚Äî Total Golden Wedges:** - 15+ golden wedges anywhere **How to Check:** - Look directly on bet pad for golden wedge count - ‚ö†Ô∏è Number alone doesn't always indicate play‚Äîcheck distribution ---
stopWhen:
- Golden wedge prize awarded (wedge resets)
- Remaining golden wedges fall below threshold

---
doNotPlayWhen: - Fewer than 10 golden wedges in green + blue - Fewer than 15 golden wedges total - Golden wedges concentrated in purple/orange/red (hard to trigger) ---
howItWorks: Pinwheel Prizes (Cat & Tiger / Majestic Oasis) features **five pinwheels** with wedges: **Pinwheel Colors (Left to Right):** | Color | Reel | Trigger Difficulty | |-------|------|-------------------| | Green | 1 | Easiest | | Blue | 2 | Easy | | Purple | 3 | Medium | | Orange | 4 | Hard | | Red | 5 | Hardest | **Mechanic:** - Each pinwheel has 8 wedges (credit prizes or golden wedges with free spins) - Scatter lands ‚Üí Increases credit value on wedge, may upgrade to golden - 3 same-color scatters ‚Üí Spins that pinwheel, win a wedge - Wedge won ‚Üí Resets to default **Golden Wedges:** - Always contain 8 free spins (all colors same) - Transform randomly (not based on credit size) ---
commonMistakes:
- Playing any golden wedges without considering color distribution
- Wasting money on non-+EV states (common hustler mistake)
- Chasing purple/orange/red golden wedges (hard to trigger)
- Relying only on bet pad number without checking colors

---
additionalNotes:
**Not Very Lucrative:**
- Rare to find in playable state
- Many hustlers waste money playing when not +EV

**Pinwheel Behavior:**
- Top pinwheels have larger default credit prizes
- Green/blue reset values are not lucrative
- Enhancing golden wedge increases credit but NOT free spins

**Free Spins Bonus:**
- Reels expand (more scatter chances)
- Retriggers: 2 scatters = +4 spins, 3 scatters = +8 spins
- Winning golden wedge during bonus also retriggers

**RTP by Version:**
| Version | RTP Range |
|---------|-----------|
| Cat & Tiger | 88.14% ‚Äì 98.15% |
| Majestic Oasis | 85.13% ‚Äì 94.14% |

title: POTS O
lookFor: Multipliers in reels 2+3 totaling 10x+ (count plain coins as 1x) | Active wilds in reels 2-3 | Active wilds in reel 4 with multiplier coins (2x or 3x) | VERIFY: background behind coins is ORANGE not green
stopPlaying: After wild reel spins deplete (coins above reel empty)
safePreviewBlurb: Pots O‚Äô Luck features coin holders above reels two, three and four. When three coins are collected to fill the coin holder above the reel, that...

images.caption: The glowing gold borders (and 2x and 3x symbols) stay on the reels when switching between bet levels. This makes the game difficult to hustle.
The middle reel here looks like it has two wild spins remaining. But look closely and you will notice the background behind the coins is green (rather than orange), so this is not a play.

playWhen: **Option A ‚Äî Multiplier Setup:** - Multipliers in reels 2 + 3 totaling 10x+ - Count plain coins as 1x - Examples: 3x + 3x + 2x + 2x = 10x ‚úÖ **Option B ‚Äî Active Wilds (Reels 2-3):** - Active wilds in reels 2 OR 3 - **VERIFY:** Orange background behind coins **Option C ‚Äî Active Wilds (Reel 4):** - Active wilds in reel 4 - AND multiplier coins (2x or 3x) above reel - **VERIFY:** Orange background behind coins ---
stopWhen:
- Wild reel spins deplete (coins above reel empty)

---
doNotPlayWhen:
- Green background behind coins (NOT active)
- Only plain coins without meeting 10x threshold
- Two coins above reel (extremely common, NOT +EV)

---
howItWorks: Pots O' Luck features **coin collection for wild reels**: **Mechanic:** - Coin holders above reels 2, 3, and 4 - 3 coins collected ‚Üí Reel turns wild for 3 spins - Coins can be plain (1x) or multipliers (2x, 3x) ---
commonMistakes:
- Trusting gold border without checking background color
- Playing 2-coin setups (game is rigged to reach 2 coins quickly)
- Thinking pots of gold display matters (it doesn't)
- Not verifying orange vs green background

---
additionalNotes:
**Hustler Sabotage Warning:**
- Other hustlers can switch bet levels after playing wilds
- Gold border stays but wilds aren't active
- ALWAYS verify orange background

**Two Coins = Trap:**
- Extremely common to find 2 coins on all reels
- First 2 coins land very quickly
- 3rd coin is much harder to get
- If it were always +EV, everyone would know

**Pots of Gold Display:**
- Just for show
- Jackpot bonus NOT more likely with more revealed

**Free Check Method:**
- Tap bet level on main touchscreen
- No money required
fullContent: ## Thumbnail ![Hero](images/pots-o-luck-1.jpg) ## Gameplay Images ### Image 1 ![POTS O' LUCK](images/pots-o-luck-1.jpg) ### Image 2 ![POTS O' LUCK](images/pots-o-luck-2.jpg) ### Image 3 ![POTS O' LUCK](images/pots-o-luck-3.jpg) **Description:** The glowing gold borders (and 2x and 3x symbols) stay on the reels when switching between bet levels. This makes the game difficult to hustle. ### Image 4 ![POTS O' LUCK](images/pots-o-luck-4.jpg) **Description:** The middle reel here looks like it has two wild spins remaining. But look closely and you will notice the background behind the coins is green (rather than orange), so this is not a play. ## How The Advantage Works Pots O' Luck features **coin collection for wild reels**: **Mechanic:** - Coin holders above reels 2, 3, and 4 - 3 coins collected ‚Üí Reel turns wild for 3 spins - Coins can be plain (1x) or multipliers (2x, 3x) --- ## ‚ö†Ô∏è BORDERLINE AP TRAP **Understand the anti-hustling features before playing:** - First 2 coins land very quickly - 3rd coin is MUCH harder to get - Game tricks players into thinking 2 coins = profitable (it's not) - Gold borders DON'T change between bet levels (can be faked) --- ## CRITICAL: Verify Active Wilds **The gold border alone is NOT reliable.** | Background Color | Wilds Active? | |------------------|---------------| | **ORANGE** | ‚úÖ Yes - Actually active | | **GREEN** | ‚ùå No - NOT active (trap!) | **Always check the background color behind the coins!** --- ## PLAY WHEN (ANY ONE) **Option A ‚Äî Multiplier Setup:** - Multipliers in reels 2 + 3 totaling 10x+ - Count plain coins as 1x - Examples: 3x + 3x + 2x + 2x = 10x ‚úÖ **Option B ‚Äî Active Wilds (Reels 2-3):** - Active wilds in reels 2 OR 3 - **VERIFY:** Orange background behind coins **Option C ‚Äî Active Wilds (Reel 4):** - Active wilds in reel 4 - AND multiplier coins (2x or 3x) above reel - **VERIFY:** Orange background behind coins --- ## DO NOT PLAY WHEN - Green background behind coins (NOT active) - Only plain coins without meeting 10x threshold - Two coins above reel (extremely common, NOT +EV) --- ## STOP WHEN - Wild reel spins deplete (coins above reel empty) --- ## COMMON MISTAKES - Trusting gold border without checking background color - Playing 2-coin setups (game is rigged to reach 2 coins quickly) - Thinking pots of gold display matters (it doesn't) - Not verifying orange vs green background --- ## Additional Notes **Hustler Sabotage Warning:** - Other hustlers can switch bet levels after playing wilds - Gold border stays but wilds aren't active - ALWAYS verify orange background **Two Coins = Trap:** - Extremely common to find 2 coins on all reels - First 2 coins land very quickly - 3rd coin is much harder to get - If it were always +EV, everyone would know **Pots of Gold Display:** - Just for show - Jackpot bonus NOT more likely with more revealed **Free Check Method:** - Tap bet level on main touchscreen - No money required

title: PUB SERIES
lookFor: Full or half-full drink wilds in reels 2 or 3 | 3 or more active drink wilds in reel 4 | On-the-house meter halfway into last segment (ignore empty/near-empty glasses‚Äîthey leave next spin)
stopPlaying: After all drink wilds empty and disappear from reels
safePreviewBlurb: (Anastasia‚Äôs Tavern / Isabella‚Äôs Tequileria / Kaleigh‚Äôs Pub / Sofia‚Äôs Cellar) The Pub Series comes in four titles‚ÄîAnastasia‚Äôs Tavern, Isabella‚Äôs...

images.caption: On Anastasia‚Äôs Tavern, the sticky wild at the bottom of reel four will be around for one more spin.
On Isabella‚Äôs Tequileria, the wild in reel three will disappear next spin, while the wild in reel four will last for one more spin.
This is a solid play on Kaleigh‚Äôs Pub‚Äîeach wild will persist for two additional spins.
On Sofia‚Äôs Cellar, the wilds in reel four will disappear next spin, so don‚Äôt play in this situation.

playWhen: **Option A ‚Äî Active Wilds (Reels 2-3):** - Full or half-full drink wilds in reels 2 OR 3 **Option B ‚Äî Active Wilds (Reel 4):** - 3 or more active drink wilds in reel 4 **Option C ‚Äî On-The-House Meter:** - Meter halfway into last full segment - Look for red showing in final segment - Located on bet pad | Setup | Action | |-------|--------| | Active wilds in reel 2 or 3 | ‚úÖ **Play** | | 3+ active wilds in reel 4 | ‚úÖ **Play** | | Meter in last segment (red showing) | ‚úÖ **Play** | | Empty/near-empty glasses only | ‚ùå Skip | ---
stopWhen:
- All drink wilds empty and disappear from reels
- Free games bonus triggers (if playing meter)

---
doNotPlayWhen:
- Glass looks empty or has tiny amount in bottom (disappears next spin)
- Only wilds in reel 4 without meeting 3+ threshold
- Meter not yet in last segment

---
howItWorks: The Pub Series features **sticky wilds + on-the-house meter**: **Game Variants:** - Anastasia's Tavern - Isabella's Tequileria - Kaleigh's Pub - Sofia's Cellar **Mechanic:** - Drink wilds appear in reels 2, 3, and 4 - Wilds stay for 2 additional spins after landing - "On-the-house" meter triggers free games when full **Reading the Drinks:** | Glass Level | Spins Remaining | Action | |-------------|-----------------|--------| | Full | 2 spins | ‚úÖ Play | | Half-full | 1 spin | ‚úÖ Play | | Empty/near-empty | 0 spins | ‚ùå Skip (disappears next spin) | ---
commonMistakes:
- Playing empty/near-empty glasses (they disappear next spin)
- Not checking glass fill level carefully
- Missing that meter feature doesn't exist on older versions
- Confusing wild appearance with actual spins remaining

---
additionalNotes:
**Not All Versions Have Meter:**
- On-the-house meter is newer software update
- Some older machines don't have this feature
- Check bet pad for meter presence

**Free Check Method:**
- Tap menu icon in lower left
- Use up/down arrows to cycle bet levels
- Wilds show on top of symbols when present
- Symbols underneath won't change

**Meter Fill Rate:**
- Increments randomly on any spin
- Usually fills quickly from last segment

title: RED SILK / AZTEC CHIEF
lookFor: Active wilds in first 3 reels only (gold border + 1-2 coins showing spins remaining)
stopPlaying: After wild spins deplete (coin holders above reels empty)
safePreviewBlurb: Red Silk and its companion Aztec Chief feature coin holders above each of the reels. When two coins are collected to fill the coin holder, that...

images.caption: The second reel will be wild for one more spin, while the third reel will be wild for two more spins.
This may look +EV with a coin in each of the first four reels, but I would avoid playing in situations like this (and most other experienced APs would agree).
This handpay on Aztec Chief was the result of someone leaving behind active wilds in the first four reels.

playWhen: **Primary Requirement:** - Active wilds (gold border + coins showing) in first 3 reels only **Reel 4 Exception:** - Active wild in reel 4 with 2 spins remaining - AND 2+ coins already in first 3 reels - Play 1 spin only to try for second wild reel - Stop if no second coin lands | Setup | Action | |-------|--------| | Active wild in reels 1-3 | ‚úÖ **Play** | | Reel 4 wild (2 spins) + 2 coins in reels 1-3 | ‚úÖ **1 spin test** | | Coins only (no active wilds) | ‚ùå Skip | | Reels 4-5 wilds only | ‚ùå Skip | ---
stopWhen:
- Wild spins deplete (coin holders empty)
- Test spin fails to land second coin (reel 4 exception)

---
doNotPlayWhen:
- Only coins without active wilds (gold borders)
- Active wilds only in reels 4-5
- Treating this like Golden Egypt (common mistake)

---
howItWorks: Red Silk / Aztec Chief features **coin collection for wild reels**: **Mechanic:** - Coin holders above each reel - 2 coins collected ‚Üí Reel turns wild for 2 spins - Active wilds have glowing gold border - Coins in holder show spins remaining **Key Difference from Golden Egypt:** - More payout in progressives/jackpot pick bonus - Line hits with coins less lucrative - **Play TIGHTER than Golden Egypt** ---
commonMistakes:
- Playing like Golden Egypt (coins only, no active wilds)
- Thinking lanterns/masks display matters (it doesn't)
- Playing single coins hoping to trigger wilds
- Not recognizing difference from Golden Egypt

---
additionalNotes:
**Lanterns/Masks Are Decorative:**
- Display above reels is for show
- Jackpot bonus NOT more likely with more revealed

**Free Check Method:**
- Tap bet level on main touchscreen
- No money required

**Game Variant Differences:**
| Feature | Red Silk | Aztec Chief |
|---------|----------|-------------|
| Bet level reset | Returns to 75 credits after few minutes | Stays on last checked level |
| Hustling ease | Harder (resets) | Easier (can leave on 750 to track plays) |

**RTP Range:**
- 86% to 95%

title: Reef of Riches
lookFor: 2 or fewer tiles remaining (check bet pad for count) | 0 tiles in 5th reel (rare but best opportunity)
stopPlaying: After all 20 tiles shattered and bonus triggers
safePreviewBlurb: Reef of Riches and its companion, Wild Mermaid, feature tiles behind each symbol on the 5x4 reelset. The tiles are shattered by line hits, scatter...

images.caption: The final tile (shown at the top of the fifth reel) can sometimes take a long time to trigger.
You can look directly on the bet pad to see the number of tiles remaining for each bet level.

playWhen: **Option A ‚Äî Low Tile Count:** - 2 or fewer tiles remaining anywhere - Check bet pad directly for count **Option B ‚Äî Fifth Reel Clear:** - 0 tiles remaining in fifth reel - Rare but best opportunity (hardest tiles already gone) | Tiles Remaining | Action | |-----------------|--------| | 0-2 anywhere | ‚úÖ **Play** | | 0 in reel 5 | ‚úÖ **Play** (best case) | | 3+ tiles | ‚ùå Skip | ---
stopWhen:
- All 20 tiles shattered and bonus triggers

---
doNotPlayWhen:
- More than 2 tiles remaining
- Tiles concentrated in reel 5 (frustrating grind)

---
howItWorks: Reef of Riches features **tile shattering for bonus trigger**: **Game Variants:** - Reef of Riches - Wild Mermaid **Mechanic:** - 5x4 reelset with 20 tiles behind symbols - Tiles shattered by: line hits, scatter symbols, or pirate character - All 20 tiles shattered ‚Üí Bonus triggers **Tile Difficulty by Position:** | Reel Position | Difficulty | Reason | |---------------|------------|--------| | Reels 1-3 | Easier | Line hits cover first 3 reels frequently | | Reel 4 | Medium | Less frequent line coverage | | Reel 5 | Hardest | Rarely hit by line wins | ---
commonMistakes:
- Playing with too many tiles remaining (3+)
- Not checking bet pad for exact count
- Underestimating frustration of final reel 5 tiles
- Expecting consistent bonus payouts

---
additionalNotes:
**Final Tile Frustration:**
- Last tiles tend to be in reel 5
- Can take many spins to shatter
- Be prepared for extended play

**Bonus Variance:**
- Bonus can often disappoint
- Occasional big wins with retriggers
- Don't expect consistent payouts

**Post-Bonus Reset:**
- Never resets to exactly 20 tiles
- Random tiles shattered after bonus
- Sometimes entire 5th column clears (best case)

**Free Check Method:**
- Look directly on bet pad for tile count
- Shows remaining tiles for each bet level

title: REEL CLIMB
lookFor: 3 or fewer firecrackers total on reels 2+3 combined (count arrows as -1) | Any reel with glowing outline and number above (1 or 2) | Arrow symbol with only 1 firecracker remaining | MAX arrow on any reel
stopPlaying: After all active reel spins complete (counter above reel reaches 0)
safePreviewBlurb: Celestial Mountain / Prosperity Reel Climb features four sets of firecrackers above each of the middle three reels. When an arrow symbol lands,...

images.caption: This is a solid play with the first reel with firecrackers (reel two) down to two sets remaining and the second reel with firecrackers (reel three) down to just one set of firecrackers remaining.
The arrow symbols that expand the reels (by exploding the firecrackers) aren‚Äôt applied until the next spin. So the first reel with firecrackers (reel two) will be active for the next three spins.
The first reel with firecrackers (reel two) will be active for one more spin (notice the counter above the reel).
You can get huge wins on this game even on small bets. This is a $264.60 line hit (the win amount was still counting up when I snapped the pic) on a $0.60 bet.

playWhen: **Option A ‚Äî Low Firecracker Count:** - Reels 2 + 3 combined have 3 or fewer firecrackers - Count arrows as -1 - Examples: 1+1=2 ‚úÖ, 1+2=3 ‚úÖ, 2+2=4 ‚ùå **Option B ‚Äî Active Reels:** - Any reel with glowing outline and number above (1 or 2) **Option C ‚Äî Imminent Activation:** - 1 firecracker remaining + arrow symbol on reel - Reel will become active next spin **Option D ‚Äî MAX Arrow:** - Any arrow symbol that says "MAX" - Explodes ALL firecrackers above that reel next spin | Setup | Action | |-------|--------| | Reels 2+3 ‚â§ 3 firecrackers total | ‚úÖ **Play** | | Glowing reel with 1 or 2 counter | ‚úÖ **Play** | | 1 firecracker + arrow on reel | ‚úÖ **Play** | | MAX arrow anywhere | ‚úÖ **Play** | | Reels 2+3 > 3 firecrackers | ‚ùå Skip | ---
stopWhen:
- All active reel spins complete (counter above reel reaches 0)

---
doNotPlayWhen:
- More than 3 total firecrackers on reels 2+3 combined
- No active reels and no imminent activation
- Only reel 4 progress (less valuable)

---
howItWorks: Reel Climb features **firecrackers that expand reels + activate wild triggers**: **Game Variants:** - Celestial Mountain - Prosperity **Mechanic:** - 4 sets of firecrackers above reels 2, 3, and 4 - Arrow symbol lands ‚Üí One firecracker set explodes, reel expands - All 4 sets exploded ‚Üí Reel becomes active for 3 spins - Dragon on active reel ‚Üí Entire reel turns wild **Counting Firecrackers:** - Arrow on reel = -1 firecracker (explodes next spin) - Example: 2 firecrackers + arrow = counts as 1 ---
commonMistakes:
- Not counting arrows as -1 firecracker
- Forgetting that active reel ‚â† automatic wild (need dragon)
- Playing when reels 2+3 have too many firecrackers
- Missing MAX arrow opportunities

---
additionalNotes:
**High Volatility:**
- Feast-or-famine type game
- Arrow symbols appear frequently
- Plays usually require limited investment

**Active Reel ‚â† Wild:**
- After all firecrackers explode, reel is "active"
- Reel only turns wild if dragon symbol lands in it
- Active for 3 spins to try for dragon

**Taller Reels = Better Odds:**
- More symbols = more chances for arrows
- Better chance for 6 crystal ball scatters (bonus trigger)

title: Regal Link: Lion / Raven
lookFor: Silver 9+ | Amber 47+ | Sapphire 58+ | Amethyst 73+ | Emerald 98+ | Diamond 199+ (if 2 meters are close, play 1 number early on each)
stopPlaying: After free games feature triggers and cash wilds are awarded
safePreviewBlurb: In Regal Link, players accrue wilds in five free games meters: amber (starts at 30 and hits by 50), sapphire (starts at 40 and hits by 60),...

images.caption: This is a solid play with 10 silver wilds collected (shown directly above the middle reel).
The credit prizes in the cash wilds are awarded regardless of forming any line hits.
The bonuses are much higher variance compared to the original Regal Riches. This emerald paid nearly 200x.
The bet pad doesn‚Äôt show the meters like the original Regal Riches, so this game is more of a hassle to check.

playWhen: **Single Meter Thresholds:** | Meter | Play At | Notes | |-------|---------|-------| | Silver (base game) | 9+ | Most common find | | Amber (orange) | 47+ | | | Sapphire (blue) | 58+ | | | Amethyst (purple) | 73+ | | | Emerald (green) | 98+ | | | Diamond (yellow) | 199+ | ‚ö†Ô∏è See warning below | **Multiple Meter Bonus:** - If 2 meters are close to playable, play 1 number early on each - Example: 46 amber + 57 sapphire = ‚úÖ Play ---
stopWhen:
- Free games feature triggers and cash wilds are awarded

---
doNotPlayWhen:
- Meters below thresholds
- Diamond at 197-198 (trap)
- Only one meter slightly below threshold (no combo bonus)

---
howItWorks:
Regal Link features **cash wilds with MHB meters**:

**Game Variants:**
- Regal Link: Lion
- Regal Link: Raven

**Key Difference from Regal Riches:**
- Wilds accrue MUCH more slowly
- Cash wilds (contain credit prizes) instead of standard wilds
- More volatile bonuses
- **Play TIGHTER than Regal Riches**

**Meter Structure:**
| Meter | Color | Starts At | MHB |
|-------|-------|-----------|-----|
| Silver | Silver | Base game | N/A |
| Amber | Orange | 30 | 50 |
| Sapphire | Blue | 40 | 60 |
| Amethyst | Purple | 50 | 75 |
| Emerald | Green | 75 | 100 |
| Diamond | Yellow | 175 | 200 |

---
commonMistakes:
- Playing like original Regal Riches (different game)
- Jumping in early on diamond
- Not recognizing cash wilds vs standard wilds
- Missing silver wilds (most common playable find)

---
additionalNotes:
**Silver Wilds Most Common:**
- Shown directly above middle reel
- Very lucrative at 12+
- Easiest meter to find playable

**Cash Wilds:**
- Function as standard wilds
- Also contain credit prizes (paid regardless of line hits)
- Same spot hit = adds credit prize (not multiplier like Regal Riches)

**Progressive Jackpots (Free Games):**
| Jackpot | Diamonds Needed |
|---------|-----------------|
| Grand | 5 red |
| Major | 4 green |
| Minor | 3 blue |

**Card Building:**
- Great game for building free play offers
- Meters increment very slowly
- Can take earlier numbers based on promo value

**Free Check Method:**
- Bet pad does NOT show meters (unlike Regal Riches)
- More hassle to check

---
doNotPlayWhen:
- Blue at 7 (common AP trap - others "sell" 7's to naive players)
- Meters below thresholds
- Yellow without adequate bankroll

---
howItWorks:
Regal Riches / Prosperity Pearl features **MHB progressive wilds**:

**Mechanic:**
- Wilds accumulate in meters
- Blue wilds: Base game (counter above middle reel)
- Purple/Green/Yellow wilds: Awarded during free games feature

**Meter Structure:**
| Color | Type | Resets To | MHB | Avg Payout at MHB |
|-------|------|-----------|-----|-------------------|
| Blue | Base game | 5 | 50 | Varies |
| Purple | Minor | 30 | 75 | 75x bet |
| Green | Major | 40 | 100 | 150x bet |
| Yellow | Mega | 50 | 125 | 225x bet |

**Wild Multipliers:**
- Wilds landing on wilds = Multipliers (up to 5x)
- Multiple multipliers on same row = Huge payouts

---
commonMistakes:
- Playing blue 7's (not +EV)
- Chasing yellow without large bankroll
- Not checking blue (requires tapping bet levels)
- Getting excited during "suspense spin" (rarely triggers)

---
additionalNotes:
**Accumulation Speed:**
- Purple: Fastest (most common chase)
- Green: Slower (occasional chase)
- Yellow: Slowest (rare chase)

**Yellow Warning:**
- Pays very well but can drain bankroll
- Common to see players abandon mid-chase
- Prime opportunity to jump in when others quit

**Free Games Feature:**
- Triggered randomly OR guaranteed at MHB
- 10 free games
- Wilds saved for "grand finale" on final spin

**Free Check Method:**
- Bet pad shows purple/green/yellow meters (just glance)
- Blue requires tapping bet levels to see

**Nerf Rumors:**
- Some believe Regal Riches was "nerfed" (lower blue runs)
- Prosperity Pearl may run blues higher (12-13 vs 9-10)
- Unconfirmed - may just be variance

**Hustler Tactics:**
- Many APs take plays early to demoralize competition
- Don't let this pressure you into bad plays

**RTP Range:**
- 85% to 96%

title: RICH LITTLE PIGGIES
lookFor: Blue pig 24+ free games | 22+ if yellow pig is fat | 20+ if all 3 pigs are fat (3 chins = max/fat pig)
stopPlaying: After triggering any pig feature
safePreviewBlurb: (Hog Wild / Meal Ticket) Rich Little Piggies features three progressive free games features‚Äîa blue pig featuring an increasing number of free...

images.caption: Look for all three pigs to be this fat and sweaty. If you see 3 chins, that is a max pig size.
Triggering the feature with multiple pigs happens fairly frequently. But it is also usually a small payout if you get a pig alone.
$22.50 is risky, but at 38 blue this is still tempting. Play if you have $2k bankroll.

playWhen: **Option A ‚Äî Blue Pig Only:** - Blue pig ‚â• 24 free games - Other pigs: Does not matter **Option B ‚Äî Blue + Yellow:** - Blue pig ‚â• 22 free games - Yellow pig: Fat (3 chins) **Option C ‚Äî All Pigs Fat:** - Blue pig ‚â• 20 free games - Yellow pig: Fat (3 chins) - Red pig: Fat (3 chins) - Visual: All 3 pigs squished together ‚ö†Ô∏è **IMPORTANT:** These are uncapped progressives. If the setup doesn't clearly match, **do not play**. ---
stopWhen:
- Any pig feature triggers
- Bankroll loss exceeds predetermined limit
- Blue pig reaches 50+ without triggering (cut losses)

---
doNotPlayWhen: - Blue pig below 20 free games - Only yellow or red pigs are fat (blue must be primary trigger) - You cannot afford $1,500+ potential investment - You are chasing a previous loss on this game - Feature already partially triggered ---
howItWorks:
Rich Little Piggies features **three progressive pigs** that build up over time:

| Pig | Color | Feature |
|-----|-------|---------|
| **Blue Pig** | üîµ | Increasing free games (caps at 100) |
| **Yellow Pig** | üü° | Jackpot prize chances |
| **Red Pig** | üî¥ | Guaranteed wilds (Hog Wild) OR symbol removal (Meal Ticket) |

**Key Mechanic:**
- Pigs get **fatter** as features build up
- 3 chins = **maximum/fat pig**
- Features trigger **randomly** (NOT must-hit-by)
- Fatter pigs are **NOT more likely to hit**

---
commonMistakes:
- Chasing pigs that "look close" (fat pigs are NOT more likely to hit)
- Playing with insufficient bankroll (can easily require $1,500+ investment)
- Expecting blue pig to trigger at 100 (100 is cap, not guaranteed trigger)
- Playing when only yellow/red are fat (blue is the primary value driver)
- Continuing after a single pig triggers without blue

---
additionalNotes: **Payout Structure:** - Triggering yellow or red WITHOUT blue = only 7 free games - Best outcome = triggering 2‚Äì3 pigs simultaneously - Yellow pig + built-up blue = potentially massive payout **Cap Information:** - Blue pig caps at 100 free games - Reaching 100 does NOT guarantee trigger **Variants:** Same strategy applies to: Rich Little Hens, and similar variants ‚ö†Ô∏è **HIGH RISK WARNING:** Most experienced APs avoid this game entirely. Uncapped progressives can create deep losses. One player lost $2,000 chasing a blue pig into the 50s. Only play with substantial bankroll and strict loss limits.

If you see 3 chins, that is a max pig size. ### Image 3 ![RICH LITTLE PIGGIES](images/rich-little-piggies-3.jpg) **Description:** Triggering the feature with multiple pigs happens fairly frequently. But it is also usually a small payout if you get a pig alone. ### Image 4 ![RICH LITTLE PIGGIES](images/rich-little-piggies-4.jpg) **Description:** $22.50 is risky, but at 38 blue this is still tempting. Play if you have $2k bankroll. ## How The Advantage Works Rich Little Piggies features **three progressive pigs** that build up over time: | Pig | Color | Feature | |-----|-------|---------| | **Blue Pig** | üîµ | Increasing free games (caps at 100) | | **Yellow Pig** | üü° | Jackpot prize chances | | **Red Pig** | üî¥ | Guaranteed wilds (Hog Wild) OR symbol removal (Meal Ticket) | **Key Mechanic:** - Pigs get **fatter** as features build up - 3 chins = **maximum/fat pig** - Features trigger **randomly** (NOT must-hit-by) - Fatter pigs are **NOT more likely to hit** --- ## PLAY WHEN (ANY ONE) **Option A ‚Äî Blue Pig Only:** - Blue pig ‚â• 24 free games - Other pigs: Does not matter **Option B ‚Äî Blue + Yellow:** - Blue pig ‚â• 22 free games - Yellow pig: Fat (3 chins) **Option C ‚Äî All Pigs Fat:** - Blue pig ‚â• 20 free games - Yellow pig: Fat (3 chins) - Red pig: Fat (3 chins) - Visual: All 3 pigs squished together ‚ö†Ô∏è **IMPORTANT:** These are uncapped progressives. If the setup doesn't clearly match, **do not play**. --- ## DO NOT PLAY WHEN - Blue pig below 20 free games - Only yellow or red pigs are fat (blue must be primary trigger) - You cannot afford $1,500+ potential investment - You are chasing a previous loss on this game - Feature already partially triggered --- ## STOP WHEN - Any pig feature triggers - Bankroll loss exceeds predetermined limit - Blue pig reaches 50+ without triggering (cut losses) --- ## COMMON MISTAKES - Chasing pigs that "look close" (fat pigs are NOT more likely to hit) - Playing with insufficient bankroll (can easily require $1,500+ investment) - Expecting blue pig to trigger at 100 (100 is cap, not guaranteed trigger) - Playing when only yellow/red are fat (blue is the primary value driver) - Continuing after a single pig triggers without blue --- ## Additional Notes **Payout Structure:** - Triggering yellow or red WITHOUT blue = only 7 free games - Best outcome = triggering 2‚Äì3 pigs simultaneously - Yellow pig + built-up blue = potentially massive payout **Cap Information:** - Blue pig caps at 100 free games - Reaching 100 does NOT guarantee trigger **Variants:** Same strategy applies to: Rich Little Hens, and similar variants ‚ö†Ô∏è **HIGH RISK WARNING:** Most experienced APs avoid this game entirely. Uncapped progressives can create deep losses. One player lost $2,000 chasing a blue pig into the 50s. Only play with substantial bankroll and strict loss limits.

title: RISING DIAMOND
lookFor: 16807 ways (always play) | 7776 ways with 1+ spins remaining | Lower ways with diamonds (expand NEXT spin) | 7776 at 0 spins with 1 diamond | 3125 with 1 diamond | 1024 with 2 diamonds | 243 with 3 diamonds
stopPlaying: After bonus feature triggers at max height (16807 ways)
safePreviewBlurb: Rising Diamond features diamond symbols that land in reels two, three and four. Whenever a diamond symbol lands, the reels expand in height by one...

images.caption: This is also a play, even with the ways at 1024 and zero spins remaining. The two diamond symbols will expand the reels two levels on the next spin, all the way to 7776.
The bonus feature is fairly volatile, but it can lead to nice wins, especially with multiple retriggers (which are easy to get).

playWhen: **Always Play:** - 16,807 ways (always play) **With Spins Remaining:** - 7,776 ways with 1+ spins remaining **With Diamonds Visible (even at 0 spins):** | Current Ways | Diamonds on Reels | Action | |--------------|-------------------|--------| | 7,776 | 1+ | ‚úÖ **Play** | | 3,125 | 1+ | ‚úÖ **Play** | | 1,024 | 2+ | ‚úÖ **Play** | | 243 | 3 | ‚úÖ **Play** (rare) | ---
stopWhen:
- Bonus feature triggers at max height (16,807 ways)

---
doNotPlayWhen:
- 7,776 ways with 0 spins and no diamonds visible
- Lower ways without enough diamonds to compensate
- Below playable thresholds

---
howItWorks: Rising Diamond features **expanding reels with diamond wilds**: **Mechanic:** - Diamond symbols land in reels 2, 3, and 4 - Diamond lands ‚Üí Reels expand one level NEXT spin - Player gets 3 spins to land more diamonds - No diamond within 3 spins ‚Üí Reels drop one level - Max height triggers bonus feature **Reel Heights (Ways-to-Win):** | Level | Ways | Notes | |-------|------|-------| | 1 | 243 | Starting level | | 2 | 1,024 | | | 3 | 3,125 | | | 4 | 7,776 | | | 5 | 16,807 | Triggers bonus | **Key Insight:** - Diamonds expand on NEXT spin, not current spin - Zero spins remaining + diamond on reel = Still a play ---
commonMistakes:
- Not knowing diamonds expand on NEXT spin
- Ignoring machines at 0 spins with diamonds visible
- Not counting diamonds on reels at lower way levels
- Forgetting reels only drop ONE level (not reset)

---
additionalNotes:
**Diamonds = Wilds:**
- Diamond symbols also function as wild symbols
- Up to 3 diamonds can land at once (multi-level expansion)

**Drop Behavior:**
- Reels only drop ONE level without a diamond
- Can drop from 16,807 ‚Üí 7,776 and still be a play

**Game Variants:**
- Pink and Blue themes available
- Same AP strategy for both

**RTP Range:**
- 87.09% to 94.06%

title: Rising Phoenix
lookFor: 3 flames + 24x total multipliers | 2 flames + 36x | 1 flame + 48x | 0 flames + 60x | Check bet pad for flame count and add all wedge multipliers (yellow wedges = 5x or higher)
stopPlaying: After flame meter fills and wheel spins (triggered wedge resets to 2x)
safePreviewBlurb: Rising Phoenix features a wheel above the reels that contains multipliers. When a phoenix lands on a reel, that entire reel will turn wild. The...

images.caption: The total multipliers on the wheel add up to 47x here, so this is a play even with two flames collected.
You can look directly on the bet pad to see the flames collected for each bet level.

playWhen: **Check bet pad for flame count, then add all wedge multipliers:** | Flames | Required Total Multipliers | |--------|---------------------------| | 3 | ‚â• 24x (or 2+ wedges on fire) | | 2 | ‚â• 36x | | 1 | ‚â• 48x | | 0 | ‚â• 60x | **Wedge on Fire = 5x or higher (yellow flames visible)** ---
stopWhen: - Flame meter fills and wheel spins - Triggered wedge resets to 2x - Remaining multipliers fall below threshold ---
doNotPlayWhen:
- Multiplier totals below thresholds above
- Only looking at flames without checking multipliers

---
howItWorks: Rising Phoenix features a **multiplier wheel** with flame meter: **Mechanic:** - Phoenix lands ‚Üí Reel turns wild, fills 1 flame spot - 4 flames filled + line hit ‚Üí Wheel spins, multiplier applied - No line hit at 4 flames ‚Üí Up to 3 wedges increase by 1x - After 4th flame fills ‚Üí Meter clears (line hit or not) **Wedge Values:** - Start at 2x - Flames appear at 5x+ - Max value: 20x (rare) - After triggered: Resets to 2x ---
commonMistakes:
- Only playing 3 flames without checking multipliers
- Missing plays with 2/1/0 flames but high multipliers
- Expecting 3-of-a-kind to pay well (need 5-of-a-kind)
- Not recognizing flaming wedges (5x+)

---
additionalNotes:
**Hidden Plays:**
- Most APs only look at flame count
- Common to find 2/1/0 flame plays others passed over
- Always check multiplier totals, not just flames

**Variance:**
- Lower variance: Smaller multipliers spread across more wedges
- Higher variance: Large multipliers in few wedges
- Need 5-of-a-kind for good payout (3-of-a-kind pays poorly)

**All Up Re-Spin Wedge:**
- Increases ALL wedge multipliers by 1x
- Wheel spins again
- Cannot trigger twice in a row

**Free Games Feature:**
- Wedge multipliers carry over
- Feathers replaced with phoenix symbols
- Wheel triggers more frequently
- Major/Grand jackpot replaces All Up wedge

**Big Wins:**
- Multiple phoenix symbols at once
- Possible handpays on $4 bets when things work out

title: River Dragons & Fire Wolf 2 Series (Forest/Winter Dragons, Wolf Queen)
lookFor: $500 MHB at $486+ or $5,000 MHB at $4,920+ | Also applies to Fire Wolf 2, Forest Dragons, Winter Dragons, Wolf Queen
stopPlaying: After MHB jackpot hits and resets
safePreviewBlurb: River Dragons, and other similar AGS games like Fire Wolf 2, Forest Dragons, Winter of the Dragons and Wolf Queen, feature two must-hit-by...

images.caption: Neither of these numbers are even close to playable.
The MHB $5k is still far away from a profitable number, but I wouldn‚Äôt be surprised if another AP jumps on this soon just to build up their player‚Äôs card.
River Dragons can be fairly volatile‚Äîthe amount of profit you make often comes down to how many good bonuses like this that you hit.
Fire Wolf 2 plays just like River Dragons.

playWhen: | Progressive | Play At | Notes | |-------------|---------|-------| | $500 MHB | $486+ | Conservative threshold | | $5,000 MHB | $4,920+ | Conservative threshold | **Note:** These thresholds account for lower RTP settings. Wait higher for more profit. ---
stopWhen:
- MHB jackpot hits and resets

---
doNotPlayWhen:
- Below threshold amounts
- Without adequate bankroll
- "Xtreme Jackpots" variants (no MHB)
- Max betting without understanding variance

---
howItWorks:
River Dragons series features **two MHB progressive jackpots**:

**Game Variants:**
- River Dragons
- Fire Wolf 2
- Forest Dragons
- Winter of the Dragons
- Wolf Queen

**Progressive Structure:**
| Jackpot | MHB | Resets To |
|---------|-----|-----------|
| $500 | $500 | $200 |
| $5,000 | $5,000 | $2,000 or $4,000 |

**Jackpot Weighting:**
- Weighted to hit at the VERY TOP
- Realistic chance starts at $490 / $4,990
- Always assume they will go to the end

---
commonMistakes:
- Max betting (increases variance dramatically)
- Taking play too early ($480 / $4,900)
- Not having adequate bankroll
- Expecting early hits (rare)
- Missing tax implications on $5,000

---
additionalNotes:
**Min Bet Strategy:**
- Always spin at lowest bet within time constraints
- Higher bets = more "gambling"
- Min bet avoids handpays and W-2Gs
- Smooths variance over time

**Competition Warning:**
- Many APs jump at $480 / $4,900
- Some take early for card points
- Watch closely as numbers approach playable

**Time Estimates ($500 from $486):**
| Bet | Estimate |
|-----|----------|
| $0.88 | ~2 hours |
| $1.76 | ~1 hour |
| $3.52 | ~30 min |

**Time Estimates ($5,000 from $4,920):**
| Bet | Estimate |
|-----|----------|
| $0.88 | ~16 hours |
| $1.76 | ~8 hours |
| $3.52 | ~4 hours |

**Forest Dragons Note:**
- Rumored to NOT be weighted to hit at top
- Unconfirmed - play at standard thresholds

**RTP Range:**
- 86% to 95%

title: Samurai Dynasty
lookFor: 1 bonus symbol in top row | 2 bonus symbols in middle row | Avoid if 3 bonus symbols visible (bonus just triggered, symbols disappear next spin)
stopPlaying: After free games bonus triggers
safePreviewBlurb: Samurai Dynasty features persistent bonus symbols that move down one row each spin. Landing three bonus symbols will trigger the free games bonus.

images.caption: The bonus symbols (shown in reels one and two) move down one position every spin.
If you see three bonus symbols, that means the bonus was just triggered and that the symbols will disappear next spin.
Most of your bonuses will be a disappointment.
Expect the occasional large bonus like this when the wild phoenix symbols lock in place.

playWhen: | Setup | Action | |-------|--------| | 1 bonus symbol in TOP row | ‚úÖ **Play** | | 2 bonus symbols in MIDDLE row | ‚úÖ **Play** | | 3 bonus symbols visible | ‚ùå **NEVER** (trap) | ---
stopWhen:
- Free games bonus triggers

---
doNotPlayWhen:
- 3 bonus symbols visible (bonus just triggered)
- Only symbols in bottom row (about to exit)
- Symbols too spread out to realistically trigger

---
howItWorks: Samurai Dynasty features **persistent bonus symbols that move down**: **Mechanic:** - Bonus symbols move down one row each spin - 3 bonus symbols anywhere ‚Üí Free games bonus triggers - Symbols persist until they exit bottom of reels **Row Positions (3 rows):** | Row | Position | |-----|----------| | Top | Just landed (3 spins to exit) | | Middle | 2 spins to exit | | Bottom | 1 spin to exit | ---
commonMistakes:
- Playing when 3 symbols are visible (they disappear)
- Not checking symbol row positions
- Expecting consistent bonus payouts (feast or famine)

---
additionalNotes:
**Low-Cost, High-Upside:**
- Only requires a couple of spins investment
- Bonus symbols land frequently
- Common to find plays

**Bonus Volatility:**
- Most bonuses disappoint
- Occasional massive wins cover losses
- Wild phoenix symbols lock and expand downward
- Wilds in top row can fill entire column

**Free Games Mechanic:**
- Wild phoenix symbols lock throughout bonus
- Expand downward one row per spin
- Wilds only land in reels 2-5

**Base Game:**
- Also volatile
- Many dead spins with occasional huge stacked hits

**Game History:**
- Originally released 2015
- Re-released on updated cabinets

title: SCARAB / DIAMOND MANIA
lookFor: Game 9: 1+ frames in first 3 reels | Game 7-8: 2+ frames same row in first 3 reels | Game 5-6: 3+ frames same row in first 4 reels | Game 3-4: 4+ frames in first 3 reels | 3+ same row in first 4 | Game 1-2: 5+ frames in first 3 reels | 3+ same row in first 4 | Never play game 10 (wilds activate this spin)
stopPlaying: After spin 10 completes (frames turn wild and board resets)
safePreviewBlurb: Legend of the 3X 2X Phoenix / Triple Double Diamond Scarab and its clone Diamond Mania operate on a ten game cycle. All locked frames accumulated...

images.caption: Five-of-a-kind wilds pay very well.
If you play Scarab and Diamond Mania enough, you will eventually stumble upon plays like this, inexplicably abandoned on the ninth spin right before a huge payout.
With enough wilds, the game can pay very well, even on the lower bet levels.

playWhen: **Simplified Rule:** - Lots of frames on the LEFT (reels 1-3) - Preferably connected HORIZONTALLY (for 4-of-a-kind or 5-of-a-kind) - Further in cycle = Better **Detailed Thresholds:** | Spin | Frames Needed | Location | |------|---------------|----------| | 10 of 10 | ‚ùå **NEVER** | N/A | | 9 of 10 | 1+ | First 3 reels | | 8-7 of 10 | 2+ same row | First 3 reels | | 6-5 of 10 | 3+ same row | First 4 reels | | 4-3 of 10 | 4+ OR 3+ same row | First 3 reels OR first 4 (same row) | | 2-1 of 10 | 5+ OR 3+ same row | First 3 reels OR first 4 (same row) | ---
stopWhen:
- Spin 10 completes (frames turn wild, board resets)

---
doNotPlayWhen:
- Spin 10 of 10 (wilds activate THIS spin, too late)
- Frames not connected horizontally (early in cycle)
- Fewer frames than threshold for spin position

---
howItWorks: Scarab / Diamond Mania operates on a **10-game cycle with locking frames**: **Game Variants:** - Legend of the 3X 2X Phoenix / Triple Double Diamond Scarab - Diamond Mania (clone) **Mechanic:** - Frames lock during 10 game cycle - Spin 10: ALL locked frames turn wild - Board resets after spin 10 **Why Mid-Cycle is Valuable:** - Payout based on full 10-game cycle average - Starting mid-cycle = Same return potential, half the cost - Fewer frames needed later in cycle ---
commonMistakes:
- Playing spin 10 of 10 (no value left)
- Focusing on 3-of-a-kind setups (pays poorly)
- Not prioritizing horizontal connections
- Playing early cycle with scattered frames

---
additionalNotes:
**Spin 9 Opportunity:**
- Almost always worth playing
- Additional frames can land on spin 10 (instantly wild)
- Low-cost +EV play

**Horizontal Priority:**
- 3-of-a-kind pays poorly
- Aim for 4-of-a-kind or 5-of-a-kind
- Later in cycle: Focus on horizontal alignment
- Earlier in cycle: Total frame count matters more

**Free Games Bonus:**
| Choice | Free Games | Random Wilds | Volatility |
|--------|------------|--------------|------------|
| Option 1 | 15 | 5 | Lowest |
| Option 2 | 10 | 7 | Medium |
| Option 3 | 5 | 10 | Highest |

All options pay the same average. Choose 15 games for lowest variance.

**Description:** This is not a play because the wild spheres will move down and off screen next spin.

## How The Advantage Works

Sphinx 4D features **wild spheres** that move down (unlike Ocean Magic which moves up):

**Mechanic:**
- Wild spheres move **down one row** every spin
- Sphere lands on lion/lioness symbol ‚Üí All surrounding symbols turn wild
- Expansion: 3 spaces above, 3 below, 1 each side (if room)

**Modes:**
| Mode | Trigger Symbol | Visual |
|------|----------------|--------|
| Day | Yellow lion | Day background |
| Night | Blue lioness | Night background |

---

## PLAY WHEN

**Reels 2-3 (Most Valuable):**
- Wild sphere NOT on bottom row

**Reels 1 and 4:**
- Wild sphere in **top two rows only**

| Reel | Position | Action |
|------|----------|--------|
| 2-3 | Top row | ‚úÖ **Play** |
| 2-3 | Middle row | ‚úÖ **Play** |
| 2-3 | Bottom row | ‚ùå Skip |
| 1 or 4 | Top row | ‚úÖ **Play** |
| 1 or 4 | 2nd from top | ‚úÖ **Play** |
| 1 or 4 | Lower rows | ‚ùå Skip |

---

## DO NOT PLAY WHEN

- Wild spheres on bottom row (exit next spin)
- Wild spheres in reels 1/4 below top two rows
- Spheres only in positions without room to expand

---

## STOP WHEN

- Wild sphere moves off bottom row
- Sphere triggers expansion on lion/lioness
- No spheres remain in playable positions

---

## COMMON MISTAKES

- Thinking spheres move UP (they move DOWN‚Äîopposite of Ocean Magic)
- Playing bottom row spheres (exit next spin)
- Playing reels 1/4 below top two rows (not enough expansion room)
- Thinking 4D gimmicks offer advantage (they don't)

---

## Additional Notes

**Why Reels 2-3 Most Valuable:**
- More room to expand when landing on lion symbol
- Full expansion possible: 3 up, 3 down, 1 each side

**4D Gimmicks (No Advantage):**
- Draw circle ‚Üí Switch day/night mode
- Draw butterflies ‚Üí Secret butterfly bonus
- All just novelties‚Äîno AP value

**Movement Direction:**
- Sphinx 4D: Spheres move **DOWN**
- Ocean Magic: Bubbles move **UP**
- Don't confuse them

**RTP:** 86% to 96%

howItWorks:
Sumo Kitty / Lucha Kitty features **persistent gold frames with credit multiplication**:

**Game Variants:**
- Sumo Kitty
- Lucha Kitty

**Mechanic:**
- Gold frames lock in place and persist
- Coin lands in frame ‚Üí Credit amount transfers to ALL connected frames
- Total of all connected frames awarded to player
- Frames disappear next spin after payout

**Credit Prize Range:**
- Low: ~1/3 of bet size
- High: Mini or minor jackpot

---
commonMistakes:
- Playing frames that already have credit values inside
- Not counting connected frames accurately
- Expecting consistent payouts (very volatile)

---
additionalNotes:
**High Volatility:**
- Much more volatile than Zodiac Lion
- Small coin = loss
- Large coin (jackpot) = huge win
- Example: $390 win vs $7.80 win possible on same setup

**Multiple Coins:**
- If 2 coins land within connected frames
- Coins combine and multiply throughout all frames

**Comparison to Zodiac Lion:**
- Similar frame mechanic
- Less predictable (credit amounts vs wilds)
- Frame location doesn't matter (unlike Zodiac Lion)

- MHB jackpot hits

---
doNotPlayWhen:
- Middle meter below $292
- Grand/Major/Minor/Mini jackpots high (not MHB)
- Coin stacks displayed on background (decoration only)

---
howItWorks:
Tian Ci Jin Lu features **a $300 MHB progressive**:

**Game Variants:**
- Tian Ci Jin Lu: Emperor
- Tian Ci Jin Lu: Phoenix

**Progressive Structure:**
| Jackpot | MHB | Resets To |
|---------|-----|-----------|
| Middle meter | $300 | $100 |

**Meter Increment:**
- Does NOT increment at fixed rate per spin
- Based on coin symbol amounts landed
- Slow and inconsistent progression

---
commonMistakes:
- Watching wrong jackpot (only middle meter is MHB)
- Thinking coin stacks on background matter (they don't)
- Not understanding the meter increments inconsistently

---
additionalNotes:
**Rare Plays:**
- Only ~4% of resets reach playable territory
- Plays are rare but easy to check
- Worth glancing at during rounds

**What to Ignore:**
- Grand, Major, Minor, Mini jackpots (NOT MHB)
- Coin stack animations on background (presentation only)

**Min Bet Strategy:**
- Play at lowest bet within time constraints
- Reduces variance

**Easy to Check:**
- Quick glance at middle meter
- Add to your rotation for occasional finds
